newsitem.title: USA: Calif. proposal would give pet adoption tax breaks.
newsitem.headline: Calif. proposal would give pet adoption tax breaks.

text.p: California state officials introduced legislation Thursday that would eliminate the state sales tax on pet adoptions.

Johan Klehs, chair of the state Board of Equalization, and state Assemblymember Valerie Brown, a Sonoma Democrat, said the so-called "Pet Adoption Sales Tax Relief Act of 1997" would exempt from state sales tax the fees and related costs incurred when adopting a pet from a non-profit or a local government animal shelter.
The estimated revenue loss to the state and local governments is about $360,000.
